member_organisations: Members are individuals, not organisations.  Members include Finance Directors or equivalent of FTSE 100 and certain other large UK private companies.
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Research and innovation, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Responding to consultations and initiatives on proposed regulations that would affect areas such as tax, pensions, financial reporting, corporate governance and capital markets.
organisation_name: The Hundred Group of Finance Directors (The 100 Group)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: The 100 Group does not belong to any such organisations.  Member individuals may belong personally or through their employer to other associations.
goals__remit:
The 100 Group is a collective voice for UK-based business, promoting competitiveness within the UK, a strong economy and long term growth.  Our membership represents the views of the Finance Directors of FTSE 100 and several other large UK private companies. 
 
The overarching objective of The 100 Group is to promote the competitiveness of the UK for UK businesses particularly in the areas of tax, reporting, pensions, regulation, capital markets and corporate governance for the benefit of its members, the UK economy and long term growth of the UK 
 
Our priorities are to: Improve UK competitiveness; Enhance the contribution of big business; and to Be connected.
